main event: On April 3, 1949, multiple witnesses reported sighting a 'Flying Disc' in Dillon, Montana.
interesting points: The object appeared to rock or rotate in a semi-circular motion, The object was metallic and reflected sunlight, The object was observed at an altitude of 3,000 to 5,000 feet, No sound, exhaust, or odor was associated with the object, The object was reported to have traveled at speeds exceeding 1,000 miles per hour.
witness description: The main observer is an owner of a construction company and was considered reliable. Other witnesses included local residents with jobs that lend credibility to their observations.
